item.description:
Wooden and Plastic Wine Packages Win

The five winning packages of the second annual Wines & Vines Packaging Design Awards. Yountville, Calif.-Little-known California wineries are taking the lead with innovative packages that make them stand out. A judging panel (including this writer) for the Wines & Vines Packaging Design Awards evaluated and rated more than 121 entries from wineries and suppliers.

item.title: Be patient - Carmichael's Milagro Centre is on the verge
item.description:
Be patient - Carmichael's Milagro Centre is on the verge

For the past two years, anxious foodies have been asking the question: When is the Milagro Centre going to open? Milagro is the upscale, 46,000-square-foot soon-to-be destination that will offer a variety of restaurants (two are now serving), a 7,000-square-foot events center, and a giant patio (with Godzilla-size fireplace) for communal sipping and supping.

item.title: How Wine in a Can and 'Brosé' Are Helping Marketers Appeal to Millennials
item.description:
How Wine in a Can and 'Brosé' Are Helping Marketers Appeal to Millennials

Move over, wine snobs. Millennials are disrupting wine marketing. The age group is outguzzling baby boomers in terms of wine consumption: 36 percent of wine drinkers in the U.S. are millennials versus 34 percent of baby boomers, according to the Wine Market Council.
